title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
description: Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper. The dish is simple yet incredibly flavorful.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Quickly toss hot pasta with pancetta and fat in the skillet.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
description: Chicken Tikka Masala consists of roasted marinated chicken chunks in a spiced curry sauce. The sauce is usually creamy, orange, and mildly spiced.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and 1 tsp garam masala for 2 hours.
Grill or bake chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
Heat oil in a large pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add spices and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add cream and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add grilled chicken and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Soft, chewy cookies loaded with chocolate chips, perfect with a glass of milk.
description: These classic chocolate chip cookies are soft, chewy, and loaded with chocolate chips. Perfect for any occasion!
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips (and nuts if using).
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until edges are golden brown.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.
